title: Definition of the Quotient Property for Exponents
text: If $$m>n$$, then $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}$$ is equal to $$a^{m-n}$$. Otherwise, if $$m<n$$, then $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}=\frac{1}{a^{n-m}}$$.
speech: If  m is greater than n , then  fraction, a to the m-th, over, a to the n-th,   is equal to , a raised to the m minus n power . Otherwise, if  m is less than n , then  fraction, a to the m-th, over, a to the n-th,  is equal to fraction, 1 over, a raised to the n minus m power  .
